Description: This feature layer, utilizing Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) data, displays footprints for all structures (buildings) greater than 450 square feet in the United States and its territories.  This one can be filtered for Residences and used to plan damage assessment.  It also has address data and is in Living Atlas
This feature layer from ESRI Federal Data has address points across the country from participating jurisdictions - not all participate.  It is in Living Atlas

This feature layer, utilizing National Geospatial Data Asset (NGDA) data from the U.S. Census Bureau, displays Census Blocks in the United States. Blocks are statistical areas bounded by visible features, non-visible boundaries, and short line-of-sight extensions. This layer is checked weekly for updates

This block charateristics layer has key information about each block, including things like number of housing units - it is a very helpful layer for building NSTA target areas.  It is in Living Atlas.

Use this app to generate a quick count of POPULATION and HOUSING UNITS, within a user-defined area.  This can be useful for assessing potential disaster impact as well as sizing potential preparedness campaign target areas.
Powerpoint presentation covering Census geography

a free set of deep learning generated building footprints covering the United States of America. In support of this great work and to make these building footprints available to the ArcGIS community, Esri has consolidated the buildings into a single layer and shared them in ArcGIS Online.

Item: Open StreetMap Buildings for North America
Description: This feature layer provides access to OpenStreetMap (OSM) buildings data for North America, which is updated every 1 minute with the latest edits.
List of all NWS forecast offices with identifiers and coverage areas
Web application with a variety of views selected from the header - by clicking on the hazard
Links to various NOAA public content.  This is an AGOL application with access to an enormous catalog of stuff.
the National Weather Service Damage Assessment Toolkit. Data on this interface is collected during NWS Post-Event Damage Assessments.
Feature Layer containing point, line and polygons of damage from NWS post-event damage assessments.  Good for mapping tornrado tracks
Time enabled Ridge 2 radar base reflectivity REST image service with WMS capabilities. Four hour moving window updating every 10 minutes with data for Conus, Alaska, The Caribbean, Guam, and Hawaii.
Access to a variety of storm prediction products - Convective outlooks, Watches, storm reports, etc.
National Weather Service Data as OGC Web Services on the Public Cloud

Extensive list of products and links.  The convective and fire weather outlook shapefiles and KML files are created based on the outlook/fire points product (as defined by KWNSPTS/KWNSPFW, respectively) then converted to GeoJSON in two versions: overlay and non-overlay. The KML and shapefile are then created based on GeoJSON using GDAL utilities. Additional reformatting steps were taken post-GDAL transformation to provide KML color-filled polygons, legends and KML tags to improve readability.
A variety of links to hurricane related products as they are available.

Navy site monitoring Tropical Cyclones and Tsunamis in the Pacific and Indian Oceans
Full featured tool for current and past hurricantes, including Evacuation Zones

This is not an evacuation map, it shows locations of fires and where to find more information. For evacuation information - see the local law enforcement or emergency management agency website & sign-up for emergency alerts if available. If your local agency provides a map of any of this information - use their map! This map is for informational purposes only.

The Hurricane Incident Journal provides relevant spatial decision-making support for FEMA leadership and a view into federal information available to the general public. This website is a part of the FEMA GeoPlatform.

FEMA's Earthquake Incident Journal provides relevant spatial decision-making support for FEMA leadership and a view into federal information available to the general public. This journal displays data from the US Geological Survey (USGS). This website is a part of the FEMA GeoPlatform.

FEMA's Tornado Incident Journal provides relevant spatial decision-making support for FEMA leadership and a view into federal information available to the general public. This journal displays data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Storm Prediction Center (NOAA SPC) and Damage Assessment Toolkit.
Links & descriptive info for National Water Prediction Servce, Flood Hazard Outlook and Flood Inundation Mapping Services

Item: NWS Flood Inundation Mapping Services storymap
Description: Storymap describing the FIM services, including what the models are and when they will be available for various parts of the country.
Interactive mapping application with river guages, forecasts, and all things water.  Has links to many other resources such as River Forecast Centers.

Description: Instructions for getting to the inundation layers
Feature service showing current inundation, updated hourly.
This feature service is a peak inundation extent covering the next 5 days from the National Water Model
This feature service is a peak inundation extent covering the next 5 days from the River Forecast Center

This is an hourly-updated feature service that is authoritative and provided by ESRI in the Living Atlas. When using - it is best to filter out Status of No Flooding, Unknown, Low Flow to clean up the presentation.
FREE site for geocoding batches of address data.
Subscription based service for converting geo file formats.

A web app that will let you pick from nearly every kind of geopolitical boundary you can think of and download the shapefiles.
The authoritative Red Cross source for HQs, Divisions, Regions, States, Chapters, Counties.  This feature layer is updated about annually.
